lines.text: Weepy, I don't like the idea of going into a bank through the front door.

[picking up sample]
Crocodile?
No, alligator.

[tossing away sample]
Oh, domestic.
Well I wish you'd drop in and look over my lingerie sometime.
Well, you drop in sometime and look over my trunks.

[to the warden on his parole]
I'm prepared to meet society, but is society prepared to meet me?
The situation calls for strategy.
I see the problem, strategy.
Hey, Pressure, why didn't she ever write me all that time we were in prison?
Well. maybe it's because she knows you can't read.
I never thought of that.
Pressure?
Yeah?
What have we got to lose? If we go in with Leo and get caught, we're back in time for the Elmira game. Hunh?
Ha, you're flannel-brained.
All right, I still think he's got somethin' hot.
Yeah, he's got somethin' hot all right! Yeah, a comfortable chair upholstered with wire!
Why we'll all be typhoons!
That woman is growin' on me like a boil.
Hey, fellas. look! Let's crack that bank on Sixth Avenue, huh?
You say that once again, and I'm gonna crack that skull of yours on Seventh Avenue.

[Talking about the bank]
Listen, this is a pushover. Leo told us the vault was in the cellar and it's put together with glue!
Hallelujah! I ain't had my hands on a vault in close to a decade!
Oh, cut it, cut it, you goons! None of that Jesse James stuff! This situation calls for strategy.
We need finesse for this job.
Who's that?
